"If you're not having shortness of breath, if you're relatively stable, we keep patients at home ... about the only reason we would bring patients in for acute care is if they're having trouble breathing or having trouble keeping fluids down," said Bratzler.

On social distancing: 

"Take the social distancing seriously,"Bratzler said. "I think if we do it early, if we really get serious about social distancing now, we can reduce the length of this outbreak and get back to normal life down the road."

On testing shortages: 

Lankford said he expects testing to be much more available in the coming week, and said Congress is trying to figure out how best to address what seems to be a looming financial crisis.
That's important because of the wide variation in reactions to the virus, Lankford and Bratzler said. While most of those infected develop only mild symptoms, some number will die.
"The third important point ... is that for every known person there are probably between five and 10 people who are infected but don't know they're infected."
"Second, it's very infectious. It spreads quite rapidly from person to person. A person infected by this virus may have symptoms before the first person even knows they're infected.
"No. 1, this is a novel virus," Bratzler said. "There is no immunity from this virus. If we're exposed to it, we will be infected.
Why has this become such a big deal in the US when the total number of cases looks relatively low?"

In 2015, I offered an amendment to the Budget Act that would improve the process & prevent those from receiving #SocialSecurity disability who aren't disabled. Part of that amendment again included updating the grid.

We have been fighting for updates for years. In 2014, I requested that the Acting Commissioner make 11 reforms to #SocialSecurity disability that they had agency authority to change and didn‚Äôt need congressional approval for. One of those was updating the grid.
The grid hasn‚Äôt been updated since 1978. Because of that, the eligibility criteria doesn‚Äôt include modern day jobs that use 21st century technologies.

Under the current system, part of #SocialSecurity disability eligibility is defined by an employment grid, which is a list of every job in the marketplace. It is used with a decision-making tool that factors things like age, education, & work experience.
